text: Pop-up retail, also known as pop-up store or flash retailing, is a trend of opening sale spaces that last for days to weeks before closing down. It mainly sells clothing that are fads. The modern trend of pop-up retail started in Los Angeles in the late 1990s. In 2018 the pop-up industry was estimated to be worth $50 billion. ==References== Category:Retail
title: Pop-up retail
